summary: This is an email chain from June 2022 regarding the nomination of the Epstein/Maxwell case team for a DOJ Director's Award. It discusses finalizing the nomination after Ghislaine Maxwell's sentencing, and includes requests for personal information from team members for the application.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, is a recipient of the email regarding the award nomination.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York is organizing the nomination of the Epstein/Maxwell case team for a Director's Award and requesting information from team members.

connections.description: They are part of the same litigation team being nominated for an award, with the AUSA coordinating the nomination and requesting information from the FBI agent.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Sentencing
events.description: The sentencing of Ghislaine Maxwell is referenced as having occurred the day before this email, described as 'the only outcome any of us need anyway'.

keyFacts: The email chain is from late June 2022, after Ghislaine Maxwell's sentencing.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was nominating the Epstein/Maxwell case team for a DOJ Director's Award for Superior Performance by a Litigation Team.
The nomination aimed to include law enforcement partners, specifically recognizing efforts with victims.
The correspondence shows ongoing administrative and recognition processes within the DOJ following the conclusion of the Maxwell case.
Multiple individuals (with redacted names) from the prosecution and investigative team are involved in the award application process.
